page.title: 01St.Helens--the town
page.content: St.Helens is a large industrial town with a population of about 190,000.It is a District Council in Mereyside. St.Helens is famous all over the world for its glassmaking.There is a large museum devoted to glass and glassmaking at Pilkington's head office.There are many different types of glass made in the town,including glass for buildings,bottles,cars and fibreglass.Industrial waste has caused problems but with the help of organisations,like Groundwork Trust, there has been much improvement. St.Helens is 12 miles east of Liverpool and 18 miles west of Manchester.It is surrounded by four motorways(M6,M62,M57,M58) The main sport in St.Helens is Rugby League.
